informally and in a way that is more suitable for use in speech than in writing: Colloquially referred to as a "brain attack", a stroke occurs when the flow of blood to the brain is interrupted. Jardine writes clearly and colloquially for the non-academic reader. See
colloquial
More examplesFewer examplesSome people accused the Vice President of speaking too colloquially.His actors talk colloquially and quickly, sometimes over one another.Sepsis, colloquially known as blood poisoning, can occur in response to almost any bacterial infection.
